info.title: StorageActionsManagementClient
info.description: The Azure Storage Actions Management API.

get.description: List the operations for the provider
Lists all the storage tasks available under the subscription.
Lists all the storage tasks available under the given resource group.

parameters.name: storageTaskName
parameters.description: The name of the storage task within the specified resource group. Storage task names must be between 3 and 18 characters in length and use numbers and lower-case letters only.

put.description: Asynchronously creates a new storage task resource with the specified parameters. If a storage task is already created and a subsequent create request is issued with different properties, the storage task properties will be updated. If a storage task is already created and a subsequent create or update request is issued with the exact same set of properties, the request will succeed.

parameters.name: storageTaskName
parameters.description: The name of the storage task within the specified resource group. Storage task names must be between 3 and 18 characters in length and use numbers and lower-case letters only.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to create a Storage Task.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

parameters.name: storageTaskName
parameters.description: The name of the storage task within the specified resource group. Storage task names must be between 3 and 18 characters in length and use numbers and lower-case letters only.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: The parameters to provide to update the storage task resource.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

parameters.name: storageTaskName
parameters.description: The name of the storage task within the specified resource group. Storage task names must be between 3 and 18 characters in length and use numbers and lower-case letters only.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

get.description: Fetch the storage tasks run report summary for each assignment.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: storageTaskName
parameters.description: The name of the storage task within the specified resource group. Storage task names must be between 3 and 18 characters in length and use numbers and lower-case letters only.

parameters.name: $maxpagesize
parameters.description: Optional, specifies the maximum number of storage task assignment Ids to be included in the list response.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Optional. When specified, it can be used to query using reporting properties.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription. The value must be an UUID.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.description: Lists all the storage tasks available under the given resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: storageTaskName
parameters.description: The name of the storage task within the specified resource group. Storage task names must be between 3 and 18 characters in length and use numbers and lower-case letters only.

parameters.name: $maxpagesize
parameters.description: Optional, specifies the maximum number of storage task assignment Ids to be included in the list response.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription. The value must be an UUID.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

operations.description: List of operations to execute in the else block

condition.description: The condition predicate which is composed of object properties, eg: blob and container properties.

operations.description: List of operations to execute when the condition predicate satisfies.

MatchedBlockName.description: Represents the condition block name that matched blob properties.

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. E.g. "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}"

if.description: The if block of storage task operation

else.description: The else block of storage task operation

StorageTaskActionUpdate.description: The storage task action represents conditional statements and operations to be performed on target objects.

id.description: ARM Id of the storage task assignments, associated with the storage tasks.

value.description: The StorageTask items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

StorageTaskOperation.description: Represents an operation to be performed on the object

name.description: The operation to be performed on the object.

onSuccess.description: Action to be taken when the operation is successful for a object.

onFailure.description: Action to be taken when the operation fails for a object.

StorageTaskOperationName.description: The operation to be performed on the object.

properties.description: Properties of the storage task preview.

StorageTaskPreviewActionCondition.description: Represents the storage task conditions to be tested for a match with container and blob properties.

if.description: The condition to be tested for a match with container and blob properties.

elseBlockExists.description: Specify whether the else block is present in the condition.

StorageTaskPreviewActionIfCondition.description: Represents storage task preview action condition.

condition.description: Storage task condition to bes tested for a match.

container.description: Preview action container properties to be tested for a match with the provided condition.

blobs.description: Preview action container properties to be tested for a match with the provided condition.

action.description: Preview action container properties to be tested for a match with the provided condition.

properties.description: properties key value pairs to be tested for a match against the provided condition.

metadata.description: metadata key value pairs to be tested for a match against the provided condition.

tags.description: tags key value pairs to be tested for a match against the provided condition.

matchedBlock.description: Represents the condition block name that matched blob properties.

metadata.description: metadata key value pairs to be tested for a match against the provided condition.

StorageTaskPreviewKeyValueProperties.description: Storage task preview object key value pair properties.

key.description: Represents the key property of the pair.

value.description: Represents the value property of the pair.

enabled.description: Storage Task is enabled when set to true and disabled when set to false

description.description: Text that describes the purpose of the storage task

action.description: The storage task action that is executed

provisioningState.description: Represents the provisioning state of the storage task.

creationTimeInUtc.description: The creation date and time of the storage task in UTC.

enabled.description: Storage Task is enabled when set to true and disabled when set to false

description.description: Text that describes the purpose of the storage task

action.description: The storage task action that is executed

properties.description: Storage task execution report for a run instance.

allOf.description: Concrete proxy resource types can be created by aliasing this type using a specific property type.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

StorageTaskReportProperties.description: Storage task execution report for a run instance.

taskAssignmentId.description: Represents the Storage Task Assignment Id associated with the storage task that provided an execution context.

storageAccountId.description: Represents the Storage Account Id where the storage task definition was applied and executed.

startTime.description: Start time of the run instance. Filter options such as startTime gt '2023-06-26T20:51:24.4494016Z' and other comparison operators can be used as described for DateTime properties in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/querying-tables-and-entities#supported-comparison-operators

finishTime.description: End time of the run instance. Filter options such as startTime gt '2023-06-26T20:51:24.4494016Z' and other comparison operators can be used as described for DateTime properties in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/querying-tables-and-entities#supported-comparison-operators

objectsTargetedCount.description: Total number of objects that meet the condition as defined in the storage task assignment execution context. Filter options such as objectsTargetedCount gt 50 and other comparison operators can be used as described for Numerical properties in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/querying-tables-and-entities#supported-comparison-operators

objectsOperatedOnCount.description: Total number of objects that meet the storage tasks condition and were operated upon. Filter options such as objectsOperatedOnCount ge 100 and other comparison operators can be used as described for Numerical properties in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/querying-tables-and-entities#supported-comparison-operators

objectFailedCount.description: Total number of objects where task operation failed when was attempted. Filter options such as objectFailedCount eq 0 and other comparison operators can be used as described for Numerical properties in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/querying-tables-and-entities#supported-comparison-operators

objectsSucceededCount.description: Total number of objects where task operation succeeded when was attempted.Filter options such as objectsSucceededCount gt 150 and other comparison operators can be used as described for Numerical properties in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/querying-tables-and-entities#supported-comparison-operators

runStatusError.description: Well known Azure Storage error code that represents the error encountered during execution of the run instance.

runStatusEnum.description: Represents the status of the execution.

summaryReportPath.description: Full path to the verbose report stored in the reporting container as specified in the assignment execution context for the storage account.

runResult.description: Represents the overall result of the execution for the run instance

StorageTaskUpdateParameters.description: Parameters of the storage task update request

tags.description: Gets or sets a list of key value pairs that describe the resource. These tags can be used in viewing and grouping this resource (across resource groups). A maximum of 15 tags can be provided for a resource. Each tag must have a key no greater in length than 128 characters and a value no greater in length than 256 characters.
